intro: Restrepia lansbergii, commonly known as the Lansberg’s restrepia, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a terrestrial orchid that typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high elevations. The plant features a pseudobulb-like structure and produces clusters of greenish-white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually elliptical and covered with a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Restrepia lansbergii is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
